summary: A letter from M. Rachel Zabala to the Victim/Witness Coordinator at the U.S. Attorney's Office, dated July 28, 2019, submitting a photograph she took on June 7, 2019, showing Jeffrey Epstein with an underage female near St. Patrick's Cathedral in New York. The writer expresses concern for the girl's well-being and hopes the photo may assist in ending trafficking and abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (United States vs. Jeffrey Epstein) and the older man photographed with an underage female on June 7, 2019.

persons.name: M. Rachel Zabala
persons.context: The author of the letter who took a photograph of Jeffrey Epstein with an underage female on June 7, 2019, and submitted it to the U.S. Attorney's Office out of concern for the girl.

connections.description: Epstein was photographed walking closely with and holding a shopping bag for a girl the witness believed to be 14-16 years old, appearing romantically linked.
Zabala witnessed and photographed Epstein with an underage female, then reported it to authorities after learning of his arrest.

events.title: Photograph of Epstein with underage female
events.description: M. Rachel Zabala took a photograph of Jeffrey Epstein with an underage female on the corner of 51st St and 5th Ave at Olympic Tower in New York City at 6:46 PM.

events.title: Submission of photo to U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: M. Rachel Zabala submitted the photograph and a letter to the Victim/Witness Coordinator at the U.S. Attorney's Office in New York, referencing the criminal case against Epstein.

locations: St. Patrick's Cathedral, New York, NY
Corner of 51st St and 5th Ave, Olympic Tower, New York, NY
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: A photograph was taken on June 7, 2019, at 6:46 PM showing Jeffrey Epstein with a female who appeared to be between 14 and 16 years old.
The witness observed the pair walking closely together, with Epstein holding a Victoria's Secret bag, and believed they were romantically linked.
The photo was submitted to the U.S. Attorney's Office on July 28, 2019, after the witness learned of Epstein's arrest.
The location was near St. Patrick's Cathedral at Olympic Tower in New York City.
The witness expressed concern for the girl's well-being and hoped the photo would help combat trafficking and abuse of minors.
